1234.33.text:
As Douglas mentioned, as a
women's and human rights lawyer,

1237.90.text:
I have witnessed the
devastating twin impacts

1243.18.text:
on my clients and those
of my colleagues.

1245.78.text:
One client, for example, was
a domestic violence victim

1249.21.text:
whose family was her
primary support system

1251.55.text:
in the midst of her crisis,
but they disowned her

1254.22.text:
after they learned that
she was HIV positive.

1257.22.text:
Another client
was a gay man who,

1260.06.text:
despite having obtained adequate
health services to address

1263.26.text:
his HIV-positive status,
succumbed to homelessness after

1267.13.text:
his abusive partner kicked
him out of the house.

1269.94.text:
He had another client -- was a
battered woman whose husband

1272.40.text:
refused to wear a condom
and transmitted HIV to her,

1275.04.text:
and so we see the
effects of this problem,

1279.51.text:
and you all well know, here
at home and around the world.

1284.32.text:
Addressing these intersecting
epidemics of HIV-AIDS and

1288.29.text:
interpersonal violence is our
administration's priority,

1292.12.text:
which is evident by
the President's

1293.49.text:
establishment of the
inter-agency work group.

1296.09.text:
Over the last several years,
the work group has worked

1299.40.text:
to identify and implement
best practices

1302.00.text:
in five core areas and
objectives for action.

1306.10.text:
One particularly crucial
objective highlights the

1308.61.text:
importance of screening
to improve the health

1311.21.text:
and well-being of women
living, or at risk

1314.08.text: of HIV-AIDS who are also experiencing violence,

1316.88.text:
and Tina alluded
to this before.

1318.88.text:
We know that screening is a
vital tool to prevent and

1321.75.text:
respond to violence and to help
women gain access to vital

1329.29.text:
or restraining orders, and
thanks to the Affordable Care

1332.20.text:
Act, screening for intimate
partner violent is included,

1335.73.text:
as Tina mentioned, as one
of the eight preventative

1338.50.text:
services that are covered
without cost sharing.

1341.64.text:
This is a huge
improvement and advance.

1345.28.text:
Increasing screening rates
amongst healthcare professionals

1348.58.text:
is vital to improving women's
physical and mental health,

1352.68.text:
and similarly, training
and screening programs for

1355.15.text:
lawyers and social service
professionals are equally

1358.09.text:
critical for ensuring the
safety and well-being of women

1362.96.text:
So, in closing, I am honored
to work alongside so many

1367.50.text:
professionals who are committed
to ending the damaging

1371.14.text:
effects of domestic
violence and sexual assault

1373.67.text:
and to protecting especially
vulnerable populations,

1376.27.text:
like women living with
HIV, from violence.

1379.54.text:
To effectively tackle
this daunting problem,

1385.12.text:
and policymakers -- all of us
in the room today must put our

1387.99.text:
heads together, and as the
Vice President would say,

1391.16.text:
we must not only respond by
stepping out of the darkness,

1394.03.text:
but we must continue to
shine a bright light

1396.56.text:
in order to prevent
future tragedies.

1399.23.text:
I look forward to getting to
know all of you in this

1401.30.text:
room and to hearing your
presentations today

1403.67.text:
and to collaborating
with you in the future

1419.62.text:
I think everybody here
is looking forward

1420.99.text:
to your tenure here
at the White House.

1423.89.text:
As we all know, and has been
truly exemplified across

1426.59.text:
this administration over
the last six years,

1428.83.text:
sound public policy is always
squarely based on the evidence,

and since launching this
initiative to address the

1434.77.text:
intersection of HIV and
violence against women

1437.30.text:
several years ago, the science
that supports our work

Here to share with us

and girls and microbicides

1451.78.text:
research in the Office

1453.79.text:
at the National
Institute of Health.

hard to make sure that

1639.57.text:
